112000.Name: Avengers vs. X-Men
112000.Overview:
Avengers vs. X-Men is a 2D fighting game developed by the Infinity Mugen Team in conjunction with Project X. It was built using the MUGEN engine with Acey as the lead designer, alongside Arkady, HyperSonic92 & ZVitor. The game showcases 27 Marvel favorites to select from, each getting their own movesets and abilities, with comic book-style cutscenes telling the story along the way.

In August of 2012, the team began work on a sequel to their release from a year prior, X-Men: Second Coming, having remarked that if anyone ever made a Black Widow template for MUGEN, they'd be required to follow through on a new project. Sure enough, Black Widow was made and the game was officially on the docket. Through collaboration with many great artists and programmers, the full game was released to acclaim on March 18, 2013, featuring solid visuals and gameplay.

Secret Characters:
• Capcom Captain America (Hold START while selecting Captain America)
• Juggernaut (Hold START while selecting Colossus)
• Deadpool (Move cursor over Spider-Man and press LEFT)
• Green Hulk (Hold START while selecting Hulk)
• Capcom Spider-Man (Hold START while selecting Spider-Man)

122262.Name: Dragon Ball Z: Ultimate Fighter
122262.Overview: A M.U.G.E.N. fighter based in the Dragon Ball Z universe, with quite a lot of characters, who, I've been assured are all very distinct and have interesting backstories. So that's nice.

140520.Name: Hyper Dragon Ball Z
140520.Overview: One of the most interesting Dragon Ball games created on the popular MUGEN engine. It is characterized by beautiful and unique graphics and combat system modeled on classic fighting games from the arcades. Easy to learn, hard to master. At the moment, the game includes 7 game modes standard for engine MUGEN and 9 characters to choose from. Hyper Dragon Ball Z is still in development, so soon you can expect an update on the new stages, characters, music and more!

141973.Name: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Ultimate Mugen HD
141973.Overview: This Mugen was made to deal with the hype that brought the game JoJo's Bizarre Adventure All-Star Battle for PS3, that is, this Mugen was a way to kill the moment while waiting for the release of the game.

142351.Name: Sonic the Fighters 2
142351.Overview: Sonic the Fighters 2 is a full game created by Neo Fire Sonic. It consists of 10 characters, all of them (except for Espio) were made by Neo Fire Sonic.

142354.Name: The Black Heart
142354.Overview:
There is another world apart from ours. A world that was once beautiful but now is a hostile place ruined by war and hate. A blood stained world...

The Black Heart is a versus fighting game which took Argentine developer Andrés Borghi seven years to create using Elecbyte's M.U.G.E.N. engine. There are six playable characters to choose from, each with their own set of special moves that can be executed using simple key press combinations. In addition to the basic attacks, players can also charge up their energy gauge and perform a powerful fatal move to finish a duel in style.

The game also features a couple of gameplay modes separate from the main story campaign, with support for hotseat multiplayer also included.

142355.Name: Rurouni Kenshin: Soul and Sword
142355.Overview: To all Rurouni Kenshin/Samurai X fans, your dream fighting game is coming to a MUGEN near you!

142363.Name: Steel Warriors
142363.Overview: Steel Warriors is a Metal Slug fan game created by MabsKMK for the M.U.G.E.N fighting game engine. You can choose over a variety of vehicles from the series, and fight others in 1vs1 or 2vs2 battles.

142515.Name: Famicom Fighters
142515.Overview:
Famicom Fighters is a 2D fighting game, the whole theme is based around the NES/Famicom era, with characters such as Mario, Urban Champion, Bomberman, Samus and Mega Man.

Each character has its own set of unique helpers, as well as its own Special, Super and Hyper Moves. Special Moves are signature attacks that have more unique properties than regular moves; Super Moves are more powerful than Special Moves, but cost Meter to use; and Hyper Moves are incredibly powerful attacks that cost the entire Meter to use.

142520.Name: Dino Crisis Mugen
142520.Overview: Dino Crisis Mugen is a fan-made action game, developed using the M.U.G.E.N. engine. Play as Regina or Dylan, either solo or co-op, as they fight their way through waves of hungry dinosaurs. With a unique premise and an in-game menu system for weapons and items, something rarely seen in MUGEN projects, the game was well-received by fans in the community for its originality.

142596.Name: Mega Man: Robot Master Mayhem
142596.Overview:
Mega Man: Robot Master Mayhem is the third official project by the Infinity Mugen Team. It began in 2009 with the release of the game screen pack and character template hoping to encourage more MUGEN content creation, as well as give players the ability to control their own environment, and ended ten years later with the final update to a fully-fleshed out 2D fighting game.

Featuring:

• 27 playable characters, including Mega Man, Proto Man, Snake Man, Metal Man, Enker, and Quint
• Several classic bosses of the series, such as Yellow Devil, Hyper Storm H, Metonger Z and more
• Power Sets: Choose from 6 different types of powers, weapons and special attacks
• History for each character, with introductions
• Unique stages for each character with characteristic soundtrack
• Take control of your favorite Mega Man characters to stop the evil Dr. Wily from conquering the Earth!

142855.Name: Ultra Cartoon Fight: Nova Geração: Versão Extendida
142855.Overview: Ultra Cartoon Fight: Nova Geração - Versão Estendida ("Ultra Cartoon Fight: New Generation - Extended Version" in english) is a 2D fighting game for MUGEN with a cast full of cartoon and videogame characters. The game is higly unbalanced, being categorized as a MUGEN compilation rather than a full game, but still is fun to play due to it's casual style and wide range of playable fighters.

AltNames.Name: Vargskelethor's Hardcore Friday Super Metal Almost Criminally Violent Ultra Swedish Meatball Royal Rumble MASSACRE!

149768.Name: VHFSMACVUSMRRM
149768.Overview: Vargskelethor's Hardcore Friday Super Metal Almost Criminally Violent Ultra Swedish Meatball Royal Rumble MASSACRE is a MUGEN build with Vargskelethor characters and jokes from Vargskelethor's streams.

150521.Name: Mortal Kombat: Defenders of the Earth
150521.Overview:
MK Defenders of the Earth v3.3 is a non-profit fan-game based on the classic games of the MK saga.

Powered in Mugen, this game uses the season 2.9 by Borg117 as base and material of the MKP 4.1 by MKP Team.

The characters were created by the mugen community of MK which received various alterations to be mounted in this game.

Stages already created by the mugen community were altered to be mounted in the game, also original scenarios were created using fan-arts, free green screen animations and sprites from other scenarios.

The soundtrack is a set of music free of copyright with their licenses respected or permits granted.
Hitsounds was taken from MKX.

150719.Name: Mortal Kombat Trilogy Extended
150719.Overview:
MKT Remake developed on MUGEN by MKTX Team. Will contain MK1/MK2/UMK3 characters with kombos, 
special moves, fatalities. And exclusive content like MKM characters. Finally, here you can notice hidden sprites extracted by Fly. All rights to MK trademark belong to Warner Brothers.

150720.Name: Rumble Pack
150720.Overview: Rumble Pack is a simple fighting game with a fairly simple play system and a unique art style. All the stages and characters are all created by Liero and all have there own unique fighting styles and pros/cons.

151361.Name: Mortal Kombat Project
151361.Overview:
Mortal Kombat Project is a fan-made M.U.G.E.N. fighter that improves upon the iconic arcade trilogy and offers up more than 50 playable characters from the MK universe, including the villains.

The game was initially planned for 2009 and after multiple releases and revisions, the "Revitalized 2 Definitive Edition" hit the internet a decade later as the fully finished game. Over the years, the Mortal Kombat Project served as the basis for a host of other games, with many being direct modifications of the inspirational original.

Featuring faster, smoother gameplay with a number of combos, fatalities and other finishing moves unique to each character, the project is a labor of love and dedication to Mortal Kombat lore and its fanbase.

152044.Name: Pocket Fighter
152044.Overview:
Super Gem Fighter Mini Mix, released in Japan as Pocket Fighter (Japanese: ポケットファイター), is a Japanese children's fighting video game released by Capcom in 1997 for the CPS II arcade system. It was ported to the M.U.G.E.N, PlayStation (which retained the Pocket Fighter title for its American and European release), Sega Saturn, and WonderSwan (in Japan only), as well as PlayStation 2 as a part of the SFA-themed compilation title, Street Fighter Alpha Anthology.

The game uses the same SD character designs previously used in Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo, a puzzle/fighting game by Capcom featuring their fighting game characters. The roster includes characters from the Street Fighter, Darkstalkers, and Red Earth games. It also features many character cameos from various Capcom games scattered in the background of the stages, such as Balrog, Demitri, etc.

152045.Name: Super Marvel vs. Capcom: Eternity of Heroes
152045.Overview:
Following the December 2007 release of the Marvel vs. Capcom: Eternity of Heroes, the game project entered a new stage with upgrades including the use of a newly release Highres Win Mugen engine, new screen visuals, a new soundtrack, a new logo and an infusion of new Mugen authors participating to bring even more playable characters to the game.

The most recent release occurred on May 31st, 2010 and continues in the public beta testing stage. Development continued on into 2011, promising to bring continued surprises to the table.

AltNames.Name: Marvel Vs. Capcom 2: New Age of Heroes

152098.Name: Marvel Vs. Capcom 2
152098.Overview: For those who don't know there is a Mugen edition of MvC2 for the PC with just about everything in it. Mugen is legal BTW. There is also a bunch of other mugen games out also(Mortal Kombat vs Street Fighter etc...). Although it is fan made it uses the same sprites from the game etc...

153163.Name: Card Sagas Wars
153163.Overview: Card Sagas Wars is a stand-alone game on the MUGEN fighting game engine. It contains custom character sprites as well as completely unique fighting mechanics and a new support card system, where fighting will allow you to gain cards that will summon characters from different gaming franchises to assist in battle. While for a while, some information on the game and trailers were revealed, the updates ceased, and after a long period of time, including the website being taken offline, the creators released an unfinished version of the game, declaring it unfinished.

153925.Name: Saint Seiya: Ultimate Cosmo
153925.Overview:
There are many Saint Seiya videogames on the market designed by fans, especially fighting games. The MUGEN engine for 1vs1 games has run many of them, but this game, Ultimate Cosmo, is the only one that offers HD graphics from the creators themselves, two French brothers who are fans of the work of Masami Kurumada.

The game is in constant development and from the many possible characters, nine are already available, among them bronze saints such as Pegasus Seiya or Phoenix Ikki and golden saints such as Leo Aioria or Gemini Saga as well as characters from the Asgard saga.

All characters have their own special attacks, and in many cases, they come with spectacular animations drawn from the anime itself that varies depending on the players involved. In reality, depending on the characters who are fighting, they will have different introductions and dialogues.

In addition to its normal arcade mode, it is also possible to fight another player, play practice mode or see AI-controlled fights. Without any doubt, Saint Seiya Ultimate Cosmo is one of the most promising fan games you can certainly find. And despite the fact that it's not yet finished, there's still a set of fighters and overall quality you'd expect from a finished game.

155883.Name: Kirby the Dream Battle
155883.Overview:
Kirby the dream battle is a kirby fighting game with gameplay very similar to Kirby Super Star Ultra.

The goal is to beat his opponent with the ability and attack of the character you have chosen.

Each character has it own different set of attack from the Kirby where he appeared.

In addition, each character has 1 (or 2) ultimate technique called “Hyper” which will be available when it has its maximum ability gauge.

The number of playable character will be very numerous, all the character of Kirby with more than 2 attacks will have its place in the game!

There will be some guests on the game :)

157998.Name: The King of Fighters Anthology
157998.Overview:
The King of Fighters Anthology is a fighting game screenpack/compilation/fullgame made with/for M.U.G.E.N™ by Duracelleur.

With most playable characters and stages made and inspired by the gold age of SNK sprite-works from KOF 94 to Neogeo Battle Coliseum.

KOFA 3rd version is not just a simple compilation. Almost 2 crazy years of seeking and digging about everything done in kof sprited style in Mugen.
720p screenpack designed by myself (same structure as the MMV one (wide menu and 4/3 fights)).
673 characters and 250 classified stages. Each character has been worked, edited, improved (with a simplified gameplay, 4 buttons easy combos and specials/hypers frenzy) in order to have the most complete homogeneous game.

162032.Name: Capcom vs. SNK: Evolution
162032.Overview:
A fan-made M.U.G.E.N. fighter, Capcom vs. SNK: Evolution REV 2 features 118 playable characters, tight gameplay, great graphics and widescreen display support in high-def.

Various authors worked on the project, including Varo_Hades, Bahamianking, DivineWolf, Infinite and "many others," according to creator Anderson Halfeld, who admitted to it being 80% complete upon release. Gamers soon praised the work for its overall polish, with some calling it one of the best MUGEN fighters ever.

163692.Name: The King of Fighters Zillion
163692.Overview:
The King of Fighters Zillion is a MUGEN project that gathers dozens of characters from the classic KOF series, adding more modern gameplay and a sleek UI.

Development started in the MUGEN CHINA forums around 2008 and slowly progressed until the forum's demise in 2012. Although the game was mostly complete (only lacking a few characters), released and open-sourced, the project is considered defunct as the original developer team has yet to reunite to resume development.

Several fan-made continuations of the project exist, such as "KOFZ Plus", "KOFZ Ultimate" and "KOFZ2"; the most acclaimed being "Rayzo's KOF Zillion 4.1 Widescreen", which aims for fixes, stability, widescreen support, characters' alternate versions, and overall improved aesthetic values.

164774.Name: Anti-Gouki Project
164774.Overview: In the year 20XX, a mad scientist, expert in clonation, decided to make clones of the most known powerful fighter of all: Akuma/Gouki. And to avoid these ones were just a simple copy, each clone was implanted with different fighting styles, all of this were made with the objective of spread them to the cities and make the total chaos and rule the world. But to determinate which is the most powerful of all, he puts the clones into his own private tournament to see which one will be the first in start the invasion.

164775.Name: Art of Fury
164775.Overview: An unknown power is creating a time paradox over the world. Merging the past, the present and the future for a day. Terry Bogard will have to fight once again Wolfgang Krauser in order to discover the truth.

164776.Name: Alien Vs Predator MUGEN
164776.Overview:
Alien vs Predator MUGEN is a 2D fighting game that brings characters from the Alien and Predator universes together. In other words, you can choose from among more than twenty aliens, predators and space marines when you fight.

The characters you can choose from include all of the characters from the famous Aliens vs Predator beat 'em up, including the Alien matriarch, an ordinary space marine, and even a 'facehugger', which can call for more creatures during any of its battles.

The game features several different game modes, including arcade, versus, survival and training modes. In each of them you can try out more than twenty characters, each with their own special attacks. The marine, for example, can launch grenades, while the aliens shoot acid.

Alien vs Predator MUGEN is a 2D fighting game that is ideal for all fans of the Alien saga, and you will find lots of familiar faces. At the end of the day, few games include more than fifteen different types of alien...

165109.Name: Saturday Mornin' Mayhem
165109.Overview: "The intro tells than a computer named Big Baby made a clone of Saint Nick named Saint Not! to create a "new modern hero" for the children of the world, but is despised, his evil toys are spurned and the kids praises other heroes before Saint Not!. After seeing this, Saint Not! ask his master for advice to rectify his situation and the computer answers his pleas by elaboring a plan consisting in putting heroes against other heroes by kidnapping their most prized treasures and crushing the remaining lone hero so he can obtain the love of the children and the world. "

165550.Name: Secret Wars
165550.Overview: Based on Secret Wars comic, the game looks like a Comic Page.

165553.Name: Tekken 3: Mugen Edition
165553.Overview: Tekken brought to the MUGEN engine. This game features all the characters from the original game and is as much fun to play. Did you like Tekken 3 back in the days of Playstation? You'll feel right at home with Tekken 3 MUGEN edition.

165554.Name: X-Men: Second Coming
165554.Overview:
X-Men: Second Coming is the first full game release in the Project X series by the Infinity Mugen Team. The game is based on the Marvel Comics story arc and debuted on December 11, 2010 with a 1.0 release on October 11, 2011.

A 2D fighting game, it features 24 characters, each with a host of combos and special moves. The animations are great, the gameplay is fast and fluid, and the development helped the team continue on to make several more games.

165799.Name: Babel Sword
165799.Overview:
Babel Sword is a shoot ’em up/versus fighting game hybrid created by Shiyo Kakuge using the M.U.G.E.N fighting game engine for the PC. It was only released in Japan. The player controls a selectable M.A.R.S., mechs not unlike gundams, to take one of five sides in a conflict over Earth’s resources. The game is notable for being the only hybrid of the two genres made for the engine, an irony given the engine for fighting games was originally designed for shooting games. The game requires the engine be downloaded separately and to have the EXE and dlls put in the root folder to function (this is due to the engine’s EULA).

Gameplay is not unlike that of WarTech: Senko no Ronde. The player selects a pilot and a M.A.R.S. (Machines of Assured Resourceful Structures, the game’s gundam-like mechs). While pilot selection has no effect on the gameplay at all, each mech fights in a very different manner, making for variety.

166285.Name: Namco X Capcom Brawlers
166285.Overview:
MUGEN fighting game

Features:
- 33 characters
- 16 stages

166325.Name: The King of Fighters: Definitive Match
166325.Overview: The King of Fighters: Definitive Match brings balanced characters, beautiful HD backgrounds, a quality soundtrack and an evolving difficulty. Choose from more than 90 SNK fighters and master the deep combo system. The game left many fans in the M.U.G.E.N. community impressed.

174758.Name: Sengoku: Basara 3 vs Guilty Gear XX vs Hokuto No Ken
174758.Overview: Fan made crossover fighting game, made with MUGEN

174874.Name: Justice League vs Street Fighter
174874.Overview:
Justice League vs Street Fighter is a fan-made game using the M.U.G.E.N. development engine. More than 35 characters from the DC Comics and Capcom universes duke it out in this 2D-fighter, released in 2016.

In a misguided effort to save the multiverse, former Green Lantern Hal Jordan uses his power to unite them all, leading to the DC universe merging with the world of Street Fighter! Can the Justice League reverse it in time? And what other worlds have mistakenly crossed over?

A veteran MUGEN creator, ZVitor from Brazil released this super hero fighter with tight gameplay and great-looking character sprites. Fan favorites include Superman, Batman, Ryu, Ken, Flash, Green Arrow, Joker, Darkseid and even hidden characters like the Predator, Goku from Dragon Ball Z, Leonardo from TMNT and Marvel's Wolverine.

176735.Name: Mortal Kombat Quadrilogy
176735.Overview:
Although the Mortal Kombat saga is not dead, since its latest installment, Mortal Kombat X is still standing, a fan decided to create his own version of the game, which uses all the original characters of the saga and some secrets called Mortal Kombat Quadrilogy .

The game is a modification of the already known for fighting game veterans, MUGEN, which allows you to create fighting games of your choice with any character, which has resulted in incredible combinations such as Marvel vs SNK vs Capcom vs Dragon Ball, among others. In the case of Quadrilogy, the characters, together with the high-quality sounds, not only bring a feeling of nostalgia but also a fresh experience.

177550.Name: Star Wars Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II

182551.Name: Capcom Universe: Nexus of Heroes
182551.Overview:
Capcom Universe: Nexus of Heroes is a full game project made using the M.U.G.E.N engine by Beximus and Walruslui. It is based visually on the classic CPS2 crossover fighting games, having original effects for Hyper backgrounds and some references from Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter.

In August 2019, Beximus moved on from the project and handed a version of the project over to Walruslui, who would later make unofficial builds based on what Beximus had finished prior.

182554.Name: Capcom vs. SNK 3: Battle of the Millennium
182554.Overview:
A high-resolution M.U.G.E.N. fighter made by Yuri Sakazaki with a screenpack by creator EnlightendShadow, Capcom vs. SNK 3: Battle of the Millennium sets the bar for fan-made compilation games.

The game features 64 characters from the sagas of Street Fighter, Rival Schools, The King of Fighters, Samurai Shodown and others, combining fast gameplay and a deep combo system.

182574.Name: Marvel vs. Capcom: Maximum
182574.Overview:
Marvel vs. Capcom: Maximum is a fan-made fighting game, created and released by Pizzahighfive using the MUGEN development engine.

The game features 4v4 tag-team gameplay with assists, including 158 playable characters from the Marvel and Capcom franchises. There are also brand new stages and the option to play online using Parsec and Discord match-making.

New characters include Mega Man X, Regina, Scream, Leon, Strider Hien, Lilith and many more.

182701.Name: Comic Fighters
182701.Overview: A 2D fighter made using the MUGEN engine, Comic Fighters collects heroes and villains for battle from the Marvel, DC, Capcom, TMNT, Hellboy and Spawn franchises. The classic Street Fighter-style gameplay features a fast and fluid system with lots of killer moves and combos.

183180.Name: Guilty Gear XX Bloodshed Type OD+
183180.Overview:
Dialing up the violence by adding more gore to the Guilty Gear XX series, Bloodshed Type OD+ rains down red in buckets in this fan-made 2D fighter, released in 2018 by VGames using the MUGEN 1.1 engine.

The game borrows some assets and inspiration from the Guilty Gear Xrd screenpack made by MustardSeedComics and Ralfab, with original elements for things like fight art and menu screens.

New features include stage fatalities, sound effects, visual enhancements to the menus and HUD, storyboards, and much more. The game was praised by the community for its great graphics and easy-to-learn gameplay.

183293.Name: Justice League Task Force 2
183293.Overview:
A spiritual successor in graphics and gameplay to the 16-bit Justice League Task Force from the SNES and Genesis era, this fan-made sequel adds more characters, more costumes and more fun.

The game was created by ZVitor, a veteran MUGEN developer responsible for several fan-favorites, and is a spin-off of his earlier project, Justice League vs. Street Fighter. There's a mix of 25 playable good guys and bad guys from the DC universe, with lots of variety in the backgrounds and stages. The game is easy to pick up and play with a move list shown before each fight, while requiring some practice to master the combo system and special moves.

The original game from 1995 was notorious for bad control, choppy animations and a limited number of abilities. Justice League Task Force 2 corrects many of those flaws and brings new life to an old classic that never was.

183463.Name: Naruto Shippuden: Struggle Ninja
183463.Overview:
Naruto Shippuden: Struggle Ninja features a fully animated screenpack, more than 100 playable characters and 71 different stages.

Fight other ninjas one by one in the classic Arcade mode, check the limit of your skills in Survival mode or team up with a friend and take on enemies simultaneously in a 2v2 slugfest.

183464.Name: Naruto: Konoha Legends
183464.Overview: Naruto: Konoha Legends is a fan-made fighting game created using the M.U.G.E.N. engine, formerly known as Naruto Ninja Battle V4. There are 98 characters and 47 stages, with the creator's aim to be well-balanced despite the large roster.

183517.Name: Tough Guy: Fighting Titans
183517.Overview:
Tough Guy: Fighting Titans is a 2D fighter built in the M.U.G.E.N. engine and released by Super Fighter Team in 2019. With better gameplay and controls, it improves upon the MS-DOS original by Panda Entertainment from 1995. The team acquired Panda's back catalog in 2012 and this updated version was considered a "labor of love" for them, said designer DeathAdderSF upon release.

New features:

• Completely redesigned fight system
• Unique "Tough Skill" for each character
• Improved animation, presentation, control
• Remixed soundtrack
• Selectable boss characters

183540.Name: The Queen of Hentai
183540.Overview: For adults 18+ only, The Queen of Hentai is an all-female 2D fighter created in the M.U.G.E.N. engine by Tetchi Mugen Hentai and released in 2015. While some characters only reveal a little, others fight fully nude with well-drawn art and sprite work to achieve a high-quality and professional look. The game plays fast and fluid, with a few secret characters to discover, and includes Capcom favorites like Chun-Li, Sakura, Cammy and Morrigan.

185168.Name: Superheroes 2000
185168.Overview:
Superheroes 2000 is a 2D fighting video game built with M.U.G.E.N. that brings together more than 350 Marvel and DC heroes and villains for battle. It offers fast-pased, combo-filled gameplay and unique tag-team specials for each character, with several different modes, including Arcade, 2-on-2 and Survival.

The game first began development in 2007 and includes freeware assets and contributions shared among the gaming community. Dozens of characters have continued to be added and updated over the years.

185623.Name: Street Fighter Z
185623.Overview: It's classic Street Fighter in all its 16-bit arcade glory with revamped colors, sprites and the Marvel vs. Capcom combo system. Street Fighter Z adds a few additional characters to the mix, as well, like Akuma, Evil Ryu, Rolento, and Haggar from Final Fight. It was created by ZVitor, a popular creator of OpenBor and MUGEN fan-made games, and released in 2020.

185677.Name: Classic Spider-Man Mugen
185677.Overview: Classic Spider-Man Mugen is a 2D fighting game pitting the popular web-slinger against various arch-enemies. There are 18 fighters to choose from, including several of Spidey's various costumes and forms, with a number of special moves and combos to perform.

189902.Name: Mega Man Battle: The Last Fight

195078.Name: Mortal Kombat Chaotic
195078.Overview: A fan-made M.U.G.E.N. fighter based on the popular Mortal Kombat Project. Featuring over 300(!) characters from across the Mortal Kombat mythos, as well as two player co-op fighting.

195372.Name: The King of Fighters Memorial Level 3
195372.Overview:
The King of Fighters Memorial Level 3 is the third installment of the KOF Memorial series by Zelgadis. The game announced and went into production after the release of the second KOF Memorial. 

In terms plot, the game don't have a story and was developed as a "dream match" for characters from all previous King of Fighters Memorial games is similar to The King of Fighters '98 and The King of Fighters 2002. Very little information has been revealed on it at this point, and the only confirmed for the game are Yukino Ozawa, Sula, Asuka, Flamme, Fliz, Nao, Khriz, Evil Ash, Zodiac, O. Element and D. G. Rugal.

199729.Name: X-Men: Next Dimension M.U.G.E.N Edition
199729.Overview: X-Men: Next Dimension M.U.G.E.N Edition is a homebrew 2D fighter with 42 playable characters. It was created by YouTuber Apex The Original, also known as Tony Apex, and released on Christmas day 2020. Fast and flexible, it's another solid entry in the expansive MUGEN database.

199730.Name: Marvel Super Heroes
199730.Overview: Marvel Super Heroes Mugen 2021 features a sizeable roster of iconic characters, plus some secret ones. Released by Mugen Player in the first month of the year, it's a homebrew 2D fighter that plays fast and chaotic thanks to the open-source MUGEN engine.

199732.Name: Mortal Kombat 3 Cartoon
199732.Overview: Mortal Kombat 3 Cartoon is a MUGEN fighter released in 2021 by YouTuber Mugen Player. It takes the popular MK characters and gives them a 2D cartoon feel, similar to rival Street Fighter. Choose from more than a dozen favorites to fight to the death, featuring numerous combos and fatalities.
